result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of misdemeanor court costs within 120 days of the court's acceptance of this agreement, unless payment plan is reached with the clerk of courts. 
-Continue attending mental health therapy services at Northland Counseling Services and follow all recommendations made by her therapist. The defendant will sign a release of information to allow the service provider to communicate with the District Attorney's office. 
The Defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, will provide verification of compliance with these conditions no later than thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of this agreement o upon sooner request of the District Attorney's Office. 
If despite good faith efforts made by the defendant, the evaluation or any recommendations therefrom cannot be completed as set forth above in this condition, it is the responsibility of the defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, to contact the District Attorney's Office at 715-395-1218 to request an extension of the date for completion. The District Attorney's Office has sole discretion whether to agree to modify the date for completion of the evaluation. Failure to request an extension in this circumstance constitutes evidence that the defendant has not made good faith efforts to complete the evaluation or recommendation therefrom as agreed to by the defendant.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. \

-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the State shall be free to argue for any disposition it deems appropriate, up to and including the maximum sentence provided by law. 
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c). 
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to dismiss this count with prejudice.

charges.descr: Sexual Contact with Child Age 15, Actor Under 19

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah Powers

defendant.name: Powers, Mariah
defendant.address: 77300 W. Maple Hill Rd., Washburn, WI 54891

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Defendant Mariah Powers in court.  Attorney Mikkel Long in court for Mariah Powers.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement. Defendant will plead to the sole count. Judgment of conviction will be deferred pursuant to the deferred agreement. Attorney Long asks that conditions be amended to allow for contact with minors, but no contact with the victim. State is in agreement. Court modifies conditions. 
Defendant pleads no contest to the amended misdemeanor count in the amended information. Attorney Long stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds that the pleas have been made freely and intelligently made. Court finds the defendant guilty, entry of judgment is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement for a period of 18 months (March 26, 2024).

9:02 AM Defendant Mariah Powers in court.  Attorney Mikkel Long in court for Mariah Powers.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Long is working on resolution and asks for status four weeks out. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Mariah Powers in court.  Attorney Mikkel Long in court for Mariah Powers.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Long asks for another status conference. State agrees.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

1:57 PM Defendant Mariah Powers in court.  Attorney Mikkel Long in court for Mariah Powers.  Attorney Chad Lalor in court for State of Wisconsin. Middle name rose.  Address verified as 77300 West Maple Hill Road, Wasbburn WI. 54891. Acknowledges receipt of  complaint, waives reading, asks for preliminary, waives timelines. Court accepts waiver as knowingly and voluntarily made.  State requests $5000 signature bond, no contact with Victim 1, no unsupervised contact with minors.  No prior history. 
Attorney Long agrees with signature bond but lesser amount. At that address since April 2020. Appears voluntarily. Asks for 2000 signature bond. 
Court orders $5000 signature bond. Conditions of no contact with Victim 1 and no intentional contact with minors.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
